verses.text: And Jacob went on his way , and the angels of God met him.
And when Jacob saw them , he said , This \add is\add* God’s host : and he called the name of that place Mahanaim.\f + \fr 32.2 \ft Mahanaim: that is, Two hosts, or, camps\f* \p
And Jacob sent messengers before him to Esau his brother unto the land of Seir , the country of Edom.\f + \fr 32.3 \ft country: Heb. field\f*
And he commanded them, saying , Thus shall ye speak unto my lord Esau ; Thy servant Jacob saith thus, I have sojourned with Laban , and stayed there until now:
And I have oxen , and asses , flocks , and menservants , and womenservants : and I have sent to tell my lord , that I may find grace in thy sight. \p
¶ And the messengers returned to Jacob , saying , We came to thy brother Esau , and also he cometh to meet thee , and four hundred men with him.
Then Jacob was greatly afraid and distressed : and he divided the people that \add was\add* with him, and the flocks , and herds , and the camels , into two bands ;
And said , If Esau come to the one company , and smite it , then the other company which is left shall escape. \p

¶ And Jacob said , O God of my father Abraham , and God of my father Isaac , the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* which saidst unto me, Return unto thy country , and to thy kindred , and I will deal well with thee:

I am not worthy of the least of all the mercies , and of all the truth , which thou hast shewed unto thy servant ; for with my staff I passed over this Jordan ; and now I am become two bands.\f + \fr 32.10 \ft I am not…: Heb. I am less than all\f*

Deliver me , I pray thee, from the hand of my brother , from the hand of Esau : for I fear him, lest he will come and smite me , \add and\add* the mother with the children.\f + \fr 32.11 \ft with: Heb. upon\f*
And thou saidst , I will surely do thee good , and make thy seed as the sand of the sea , which cannot be numbered for multitude. \p
¶ And he lodged there that same night ; and took of that which came to his hand a present for Esau his brother ;
Two hundred she goats , and twenty he goats , two hundred ewes , and twenty rams ,
Thirty milch camels with their colts , forty kine , and ten bulls , twenty she asses , and ten foals.
And he delivered \add them\add* into the hand of his servants , every drove by themselves; and said unto his servants , Pass over before me , and put a space betwixt drove and drove.
And he commanded the foremost , saying , When Esau my brother meeteth thee , and asketh thee , saying , Whose \add art\add* thou? and whither goest thou? and whose \add are\add* these before thee?
Then thou shalt say , \add They be\add* thy servant Jacob’s ; it \add is\add* a present sent unto my lord Esau : and, behold, also he \add is\add* behind us.
And so commanded he the second , and the third , and all that followed the droves , saying , On this manner shall ye speak unto Esau , when ye find him.

And say ye moreover , Behold, thy servant Jacob \add is\add* behind us. For he said , I will appease him with the present that goeth before me , and afterward I will see his face ; peradventure he will accept of me.\f + \fr 32.20 \ft of me: Heb. my face\f*
So went the present over before him : and himself lodged that night in the company.
And he rose up that night , and took his two wives , and his two womenservants , and his eleven sons , and passed over the ford Jabbok.
And he took them , and sent them over the brook , and sent over that he had.\f + \fr 32.23 \ft sent them: Heb. caused to pass\f* \p
¶ And Jacob was left alone; and there wrestled a man with him until the breaking of the day.\f + \fr 32.24 \ft breaking…: Heb. ascending of the morning\f*
And when he saw that he prevailed not against him, he touched the hollow of his thigh ; and the hollow of Jacob’s thigh was out of joint , as he wrestled with him.
And he said , Let me go , for the day breaketh. And he said , I will not let thee go , except thou bless me.
And he said unto him, What \add is\add* thy name ? And he said , Jacob.
And he said , Thy name shall be called no more Jacob , but Israel : for as a prince hast thou power with God and with men , and hast prevailed.\f + \fr 32.28 \ft Israel: that is, A prince of God\f*
And Jacob asked \add him\add*, and said , Tell \add me\add*, I pray thee, thy name. And he said , Wherefore \add is\add* it \add that\add* thou dost ask after my name ? And he blessed him there.
And Jacob called the name of the place Peniel : for I have seen God face to face , and my life is preserved.\f + \fr 32.30 \ft Peniel: that is, The face of God\f*
And as he passed over Penuel the sun rose upon him, and he halted upon his thigh.

Therefore the children of Israel eat not \add of\add* the sinew which shrank , which \add is\add* upon the hollow of the thigh , unto this day : because he touched the hollow of Jacob’s thigh in the sinew that shrank.
